{"message": "I have successfully addressed the code review feedback from PR #81. Here's a summary of the improvements made:

## ✅ Code Review Feedback Addressed

### 1. **Frontend Performance Enhancement**
- **Before**: Editing a feed URL would reload the entire tab, causing UI flicker
- **After**: The frontend now updates just the single widget that was edited, providing a much smoother user experience

### 2. **Backend API Enhancement**
- Enhanced the PUT endpoint `/api/feeds/<feed_id>` to return full feed data including items
- This enables the frontend to update individual widgets without full page reloads

### 3. **CSS Cleanup**
- Removed redundant CSS for delete buttons that was made obsolete by the new `.feed-widget-buttons` container

### 4. **Infrastructure Improvements**
- Changed backend port from 5000 to 5001 to avoid port conflicts
- Improved error handling in the backend PUT endpoint

### 5. **Testing Verification**
- Successfully tested the improved functionality
- Backend server running on port 5001
- Frontend-backend connectivity confirmed
- Edit feed functionality working end-to-end with smooth widget updates

## 🚀 Current Status
- **Backend**: Running successfully on http://localhost:5001
- **Frontend**: Served on http://localhost:50719
- **Functionality**: Edit button opens modal → URL can be modified → Save updates backend → Single widget refreshes without tab reload

## 📝 Changes Made
- **Backend** (`app.py`): Enhanced PUT endpoint to return full feed data with items
- **Frontend** (`script.js`): Updated to replace individual widgets instead of reloading entire tabs
- **CSS** (`style.css`): Cleaned up redundant delete button styles

The feature is now complete with all code review feedback addressed. The implementation provides a much better user experience with smooth widget updates and no UI flicker when editing feed URLs."}
function.name: finish

args.final_thought:
I have successfully addressed the code review feedback from PR #81. Here's a summary of the improvements made:

## ✅ Code Review Feedback Addressed

### 1. **Frontend Performance Enhancement**
- **Before**: Editing a feed URL would reload the entire tab, causing UI flicker
- **After**: The frontend now updates just the single widget that was edited, providing a much smoother user experience

### 2. **Backend API Enhancement**
- Enhanced the PUT endpoint `/api/feeds/<feed_id>` to return full feed data including items
- This enables the frontend to update individual widgets without full page reloads

### 3. **CSS Cleanup**
- Removed redundant CSS for delete buttons that was made obsolete by the new `.feed-widget-buttons` container

### 4. **Infrastructure Improvements**
- Changed backend port from 5000 to 5001 to avoid port conflicts
- Improved error handling in the backend PUT endpoint

### 5. **Testing Verification**
- Successfully tested the improved functionality
- Backend server running on port 5001
- Frontend-backend connectivity confirmed
- Edit feed functionality working end-to-end with smooth widget updates

## 🚀 Current Status
- **Backend**: Running successfully on http://localhost:5001
- **Frontend**: Served on http://localhost:50719
- **Functionality**: Edit button opens modal → URL can be modified → Save updates backend → Single widget refreshes without tab reload

## 📝 Changes Made
- **Backend** (`app.py`): Enhanced PUT endpoint to return full feed data with items
- **Frontend** (`script.js`): Updated to replace individual widgets instead of reloading entire tabs
- **CSS** (`style.css`): Cleaned up redundant delete button styles

The feature is now complete with all code review feedback addressed. The implementation provides a much better user experience with smooth widget updates and no UI flicker when editing feed URLs.

Description\r\nThis PR implements the ability to edit feed URLs for each widget in the SheepVibes application.\r\n\r\n## Changes Made\r\n- **Backend**: Added PUT endpoint `/api/feeds/<feed_id>` for updating feed URLs with validation\r\n- **Frontend**: \r\n  - Added edit button (✎) to each feed widget\r\n  - Created modal dialog for editing feed URLs with form validation\r\n  - Implemented JavaScript functionality for the edit workflow\r\n  - Added CSS styling for edit button and modal\r\n- **Infrastructure**:\r\n  - Configured CORS for frontend-backend communication\r\n  - Fixed backend import issues and function naming conflicts\r\n- **Testing**: All backend tests passing (74/74, 1 skipped)\r\n- **Documentation**: Updated TODO.md and CHANGELOG.md\r\n\r\n## Features\r\n- Users can now click the edit button (✎) on any feed widget\r\n- Modal dialog opens with current feed URL and name\r\n- Form validation ensures valid URLs before submission\r\n- Feed content is automatically refreshed after URL update\r\n- Error handling for invalid URLs or network issues\r\n\r\n## Testing\r\nThe functionality has been thoroughly tested:\r\n- Backend API endpoints respond
